title: Creating survival plot
code: # Load required libraries library(survSAKK) library(survival)  # Load data veteran <- survival::veteran  # Define the reference arm veteran$trt <- factor(veteran$trt,                       levels = c(1,2),                       labels = c("Standard","Test"))  # Create survival objects veteran_fit_yr <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25, status) ~ 1, data = veteran) veteran_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25 * 12, status) ~ 1, data = veteran) veteran_trt_fit_yr <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25, status) ~ trt, data = veteran) veteran_trt_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25 * 12, status) ~ trt, data = veteran)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr)

previous_headings: Drawing survival plot > Customisation of axis limits and label
what: Renaming of the labels and Axis:
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Label           main = "Veterans' Administration Lung Cancer study",            xlab = "Time (year)",            legend.name = c("Veteran's"),           # Limits           x.ticks = seq(0,3,by = 0.5))

previous_headings: Drawing survival plot > Customisation of axis limits and label
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Label           main = "Veterans' Administration Lung Cancer study",            xlab = "Time (year)",            legend.name = c("Veteran's"),           # Limits           x.ticks = seq(0,3,by = 0.5),           cex = 0.8)

previous_headings: Drawing survival plot > Customisation of axis limits and label
what: Custamisation of the x and y axis label position
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           # Specifies on which line on the plotting area            # X and Y label should be drawn           xlab.pos = 3,           ylab.pos = 3.75)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,             # How many bottom lines should be drawn           margin.bottom = 10,           # How many left lines should be drawn           margin.left = 8)

title: Creating survival plot
text: section shown highlight specific quantile time point segment survival curve adjust segment options.

what: Drawing segment line for a specific quantile
title: Creating survival plot
text: Drawing segment line median, corresponds 0.5 quantile.
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.quantile = 0.5)

what: Drawing segment line for a specific time point
title: Creating survival plot
text: Drawing segment line time point 1.
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.timepoint = 1)

what: Renaming segment title, font size, and colour
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.main = "Median survival time",           segment.annotation = "bottomleft",           segment.cex = 0.75,           segment.col = "darkred")

what: Add several segment lines, change line type
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.timepoint = c(0.5,1,2),           segment.type = 2,           segment.annotation = "none")

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.type = 1,           segment.cex = 0.75,           segment.font = 3,           segment.main.font = 2)

what: Modify segment line type, line width and text spacing
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation = c(3, 0.06),           segment.col = "darkgreen",           ## segment type            segment.type = 1,           ## segment line type           segment.lty = 'dotted',           ## segment line width           segment.lwd = 1.5,           # spacing between the text in unit of x-coordinates           segment.annotation.space = 0.16)

title: Creating survival plot
text: three options display statistics: logrank gives p value conducted log rank test using survdiff{survival}. coxph gives hazard ratio (HR) 95% CI conducted Cox proportional hazards regression using coxph{survival}.‚Å† coxmodel gives N (number observations), Events (Number events), HR(hazard ratio), lwrCI (lower 95% confidence interval), uprCI (upper 95% confidence interval) Logrank (p-value corresponding Chisquare statistic) conduct Cox proportional hazards regression using summary(coxph{survival}).

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           stat = "logrank")

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           show.legend = FALSE,           stat = "coxph",           stat.position = "bottomright")

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           cex = 0.8,           legend.position = "right",           stat = "coxmodel",           stat.position = "topright")

what: Modify stat position, colour, text size, and text font
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           stat = "logrank",           stat.position = "bottomright",           stat.col = "darkblue",           stat.cex = 0.85,           stat.font = 2)

title: Creating survival plot
text: Per default risk table provided Kaplan-Meier plot. provides information number patients risk different time points thought study.

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           risktable = FALSE)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,             # How many bottom lines should be drawn           margin.bottom = 10,           # How many left lines should be drawn           margin.left = 4,           # Define position of the risk table           risktable.pos = 8.5)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           risktable.title = "# at risk",           risktable.title.font = 3,           risktable.title.col = "purple",           # specifying the position of the title on the x-axis           risktable.title.position = -0.5)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           risktable.name.col = "darkgreen",           risktable.name.font = 3,           # specifying the position of the title on the x-axis           risktable.name.position = -0.45)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           risktable.col = "darkred")

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           risktable.cex = 0.9,           risktable.title.cex = 0.85,           risktable.name.cex = 0.80)

title: Creating survival plot
code: par(mfrow=c(2,2)) # Plot 1 surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr,           cex = 0.8,           risktable.name.position = -0.7) # Plot 2 surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr,            x.ticks = seq(0,3,0.5),           cex = 0.8,           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation = "none",           risktable.name.position = -0.5) # Plot 3 surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr,            col = "darkred",           x.ticks = seq(0,3,0.5),           cex = 0.8,           legend.name = "Veterans",           show.legend = FALSE,           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation = "right",           segment.cex = 0.7,           risktable.name.position = -0.7) par(mfrow=c(1,1)) par(mfrow=c(2,1)) # Plot 1 surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_yr,           bty = 'o',           cex = 0.75,           legend.title = "Treament regimens",           legend.name = c("LT60","OV60"),           legend.text.font = 2,           col = c("darkred", "darkblue"),           x.ticks = seq(0,3, by = 0.5),           xlab = ("Time (month)"),           segment.quantile = 0.5,           stat = "logrank",            stat.position = "bottomleft",           risktable.col = c("darkred","darkblue"))  # Plot 2 surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_yr,           grid =TRUE,           cex = 0.75,           col = c("darkgreen","yellow4"),           xlab = "Time (year)",           x.ticks = seq(0,3, by = 1),           legend.position = "bottomleft",           stat = "coxmodel",           stat.position = "bottomright") par(mfrow=c(1,1))

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
text: goal survSAKK create open source, user-friendly flexible R package, incorporate various statistics layout customization options enhance efficiency adaptability Kaplan-Meier plot.

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
text: can install current version survSAKK GitHub Pages:
code: # install.packages("devtools")  # At the moment, while repository is private: devtools::install_github("SAKK-Statistics/survSAKK",                          auth_token = "ask_for_the_password",                          build_vignettes = TRUE,                          force = TRUE)  # Later, when the repository is public: devtools::install_github("SAKK-Statistics/survSAKK",                          build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
code: library(survSAKK) library(survival)  lung_fit <- survfit(Surv((time/365.25), status) ~ sex, data = lung)  surv.plot(fit = lung_fit)

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Estimator ‚Äî surv.plot
text: surv.plot(fit, ...) returns Kaplan-Meier survival time curves.

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Estimator ‚Äî surv.plot
text: fit object class survival::survfit containing survival data. reference.arm character string specifying reference arm comparison. time.unit character string specifying time unit used create fit object. Note: time.unit convert time fit object. Option include: "day", "week", "month","year". y.unit character string specifying unit y-axis. Option include: "probability", "percent". censoring.mark logical parameter indicating whether censoring events marked survival curves. Default TRUE. censoring.cex numeric value specifying size marks censored patients. Default 1.3. conf.int numeric value controlling confidence interval survival curves. Default 0.95, corresponding 95% confidence interval. Values 0 1 represent desired confidence interval. set 0, confidence intervals displayed. conf.band logical parameter indicating whether display confidence band survival curves. Default TRUE. conf.line logical parameter indicating whether draw confidence line survival curves. Default FALSE. conf.band.col colour used confidence band. Can accept single colour value vector colours. conf.band.transparent numeric value 0 1 controlling transparency confidence band. Default 0.25. conf.type Transformation type confidence interval. Options include: "log", "log-log", "plain", "logit", "arcsin". Default log-log. grid logical parameter specifying whether draw grid. Default FALSE. col colour used survival curves. Can accept single colour value  vector colours. main Title plot. sub Subtitle plot. Note: subtitle displayed risk table shown. xlab X-axis label. ylab Y-axis label. xticks numeric vector specifying ticks x-axis. Can specified seq(= , = , = ). : starting value : end value : number; increment sequence yticks numeric vector specifying ticks y-axis. Can specified seq(= , = , = ). : starting value : end value : number; increment sequence Note: always specified probability. xlab.pos Defines margin line x-axis label (xlab) displayed, starting 0 counting outwards. ylab.pos Defines margin line y-axis label (ylab) displayed, starting 0 counting outwards. xlab.cex numeric value specifying size X-axis label. ylab.cex numeric value specifying size y-axis label. cex numeric value specifying size text elements (labels, annotations, etc.). axis.cex numeric value specifying size axis elements. bty Determines style box drawn around plot. Options include: "n" ,"o","c","u". Default : "n". lty vector three arguments specifying line types curve, lower confidence line upper confidence line. Options include: "blank", "solid", "dashed", "dotted", "dotdash", "longdash", "twodash". Example: c("solid", "dashed", "dashed"). lwd numeric value specifying width line. legend logical parameter specifying whether display legend. default, legend displayed one arm. legend.position Position legend. Options include: "c(x,y)", "bottomright", "bottom", "bottomleft", "left"`, legend.name vector character string specifying name(s) arm(s). legend.cex numeric value specifying size legend text. legend.text.font Font style legend text. Possible values: 1 normal 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold italic legend.title Title legend. legend.title.cex numeric value specifying size legend title. segment.type numeric value specifying layout segment. Possible values: 1 full width 2 half width 3 vertical horizontal segment (default) segment.timepoint single value vector fixed time points drawn segment(s). segment.quantile single value vector fixed quantile drawn segment(s). Example: 0.5 corresponds median. segment.main Title segment text. segment.confint logical parameter specifying whether display confidence interval segment. NOTE: possible set segment.confint = FALSE two arms. Default TRUE. segment.annotation Position segment annotation. Options include: c(x,y),"bottomleft", "left", "right", "top", "none". segment.annotation.col colour used segment annotation. Can accept single colour value vector colours. segment.annotation.space Spacing text units x-coordinates. segment.col colour used segment. Can accept single colour value. segment.lty strings specifying line types curve. Options include: "blank", "solid", "dashed", "dotted", "dotdash", "longdash", "twodash". segment.lwd numeric value specifying width segment line. segment.cex numeric value specifying size segment text size. segment.font numeric value specifying font face. Possible values: 1 plain 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold-italic segment.main.font numeric value specifying font face segment text. Possible values: 1 plain 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold-italic stat.fit object class survival::survfit containing survival data. Used calculation statistics, allowing add stratification factors. Note: specified fit object used stat. stat Statistics displayed plot. Options: "logrank" gives p value conducted logrank test using survdiff{survival}. tests difference two survival curves. "coxph"  gives hazard ratio (HR) CI (default: 95% CI)conducted Cox proportional hazards regression using coxph{survival}. Note: option works two arms. "coxph_logrank" combines hazard ratio (HR), CI (default: 95% CI) logrank test. Note: option works two arms. 'none' statistic displayed (default). Note: Confidence interval can adjusted argument stat.conf.int. stat.position Position stat displayed. Options include: c(x,y),"bottomleft", "left", "right", "top", "topright","bottomright", "none". stat.conf.int numeric value controlling confidence interval stat (hazard ratio). Default 0.95, corresponds 95% confidence interval. Values 0 1 represent desired confidence interval. stat.col colour used statistics text. Can accept single colour value vector colours. stat.cex numeric value specifying size `statistics text size. stat.font font face statistics Possible values: 1 plain 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold-italic risktable logical parameter indicating whether draw risk table. Default TRUE. risktable.pos Defines margin line xlab displayed, starting 0 counting outwards. Default line 3. risktable.name Names arms risk table. risktable.cex numeric value specifying size risk table text size. risktable.col coulour used risk table. Can accept single colour value vector colours. Default black. Note: risktable.col = TRUE colours curves used. risktable.title Title risk table. risktable.title.font Font style risk table. Possible values: 1 normal 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold italic risktable.title.col colour used risk table title. Can accept single colour value. risktable.title.position numeric value specifying position title x-axis. risktable.title.cex numeric value specifying size risk table title size. risktable.name.cex numeric value specifying size risk table legend name size. risktable.name.font Font style risk table legend name(s). Possible values: 1 normal 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold italic risktable.name.col colour used risk table name. Can accept single colour value. risktable.name.position numeric value specifying position legend name(s) x-axis. margin.bottom Specifies bottom margin plotting area line units. Default 5. margin.left Specifies left margin plotting area line units. Default 6 (risktable) 4 (without risktable). margin.top Specifies top margin plotting area line units. Default 3. margin.right Specifies right margin plotting area line units. Default 2.

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Estimator ‚Äî surv.plot
text: Kaplan-Meier curves input fit, incorporating various statistics layout option(s).

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Estimator ‚Äî surv.plot
text: survSAKK R package provides surv.plot() function, facilitating Kaplan-Meier survival analysis. Designed user-friendliness efficiency mind. Offering robust tool analysing survival data. utilises functionalities survival::survfit(). comprehensive manual visit: https://sakk-statistics.github.io/survSAKK/articles/surv.plot.html

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Estimator ‚Äî surv.plot
text: Therneau T (2024). Package Survival Analysis R. R package version 3.5-8, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=survival. Terry M. Therneau, Patricia M. Grambsch (2000). Modeling Survival Data: Extending Cox Model. Springer, New York. ISBN 0-387-98784-3.

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Estimator ‚Äî surv.plot
text: Vithersan Somasundaram Katrin Gysel

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Estimator ‚Äî surv.plot
code: require(survival)  require(survSAKK)  # Create survival object  veteran_trt_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.12 * 12, status) ~ trt, data = veteran)  # Generate survival plots  surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_mt,    time.unit = "month",    reference.arm = 1,    legend.name =  c("Standard", "Test"))
